briefdescription.para: This file provides an interface to the boot loader.

detaileddescription.para: Functions defined in this file should only be called while the boot loader is running.

memberdef.name: BOOT_LOG_SWAP_STATE
memberdef.initializer: BOOT_LOG_INF("%s: magic=%s, copy_done=0x%x, image_ok=0x%x", \ (area), \ ((state)->magic == BOOT_MAGIC_GOOD ? "good" : \ (state)->magic == BOOT_MAGIC_UNSET ? "unset" : \ "bad"), \ (state)->copy_done, \ (state)->image_ok)

briefdescription.para: This set of tables maps swap state contents to boot status location.

detaileddescription.para: When searching for a match, these tables must be iterated in order.

briefdescription.para: Determines where in flash the most recent boot status is stored.

detaileddescription.para: The boot status is necessary for completing a swap that was interrupted by a boot loader reset.

simplesect.para: BOOT_STATUS_SOURCE_[...] code indicating where status should be read from.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the type of swap that just completed.

detaileddescription.para: This is used when a swap is interrupted by an external event. After finishing the swap operation determines what the initial request was.

briefdescription.para: Determines the sector layout of both image slots and the scratch area.

detaileddescription.para: This information is necessary for calculating the number of bytes to erase and copy during an image swap. The information collected during this function is used to populate the boot_data global.

briefdescription.para: Reads the status of a partially-completed swap, if any.

detaileddescription.para: This is necessary to recover in case the boot lodaer was reset in the middle of a swap operation.

briefdescription.para: Reads the boot status from the flash.

detaileddescription.para: The boot status contains the current state of an interrupted image copy operation. If the boot status is not present, or it indicates that previous copy finished, there is no operation in progress.

briefdescription.para: Writes the supplied boot status to the flash file system.

detaileddescription.para: The boot status contains the current state of an in-progress image copy operation.

briefdescription.para: Determines which swap operation to perform, if any.

detaileddescription.para: If it is determined that a swap operation is required, the image in the second slot is checked for validity. If the image in the second slot is invalid, it is erased, and a swap type of "none" is indicated.

simplesect.para: The type of swap to perform (BOOT_SWAP_TYPE...)

briefdescription.para: Calculates the number of sectors the scratch area can contain.

detaileddescription.para: A "last" source sector is specified because images are copied backwards in flash (final index to index number 0).

parameterdescription.para: The index of the last source sector (inclusive).
The index of the first source sector (inclusive) gets written here.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes comprised by the [first-sector, last-sector] range.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the flash area containing the region to erase.
The offset within the flash area to start the erase.
The number of bytes to erase.

memberdef.argsstring: (int flash_area_id_src, int flash_area_id_dst, uint32_t off_src, uint32_t off_dst, uint32_t sz)
memberdef.name: boot_copy_sector

briefdescription.para: Copies the contents of one flash region to another.

detaileddescription.para: You must erase the destination region prior to calling this function.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the source flash area.
The ID of the destination flash area.
The offset within the source flash area to copy from.
The offset within the destination flash area to copy to.
The number of bytes to copy.

briefdescription.para: Swaps the contents of two flash regions within the two image slots.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the first sector in the range of sectors being swapped.
The number of bytes to swap.
The current boot status. This struct gets updated according to the outcome.

briefdescription.para: Swaps the two images in flash.

detaileddescription.para: If a prior copy operation was interrupted by a system reset, this function completes that operation.

parameterdescription.para: The current boot status. This function reads this struct to determine if it is resuming an interrupted swap operation. This function writes the updated status to this function on return.

briefdescription.para: Marks the image in slot 0 as fully copied.
Marks a reverted image in slot 0 as confirmed.

detaileddescription.para: This is necessary to ensure the status bytes from the image revert operation don't get processed on a subsequent boot.
NOTE: image_ok is tested before writing because if there's a valid permanent image installed on slot0 and the new image to be upgrade to has a bad sig, image_ok would be overwritten.

briefdescription.para: Performs an image swap if one is required.

parameterdescription.para: On success, the type of swap performed gets written here.

detaileddescription.para: This function moves images around in flash as appropriate, and tells you what address to boot from.

parameterdescription.para: On success, indicates how booting should occur.
